122// This special constant is used to indicate that a particular vertex descriptor's buffer layout
123// index is unused.
124constexpr MTLVertexStepFunction kVertexStepFunctionInvalid =
125 static_cast<MTLVertexStepFunction>(0xff);

147enum class PixelType
148{
149 Int,
150 UInt,
151 Float,
152 EnumCount,
153};
154
155template <typename T>
156struct ImplTypeHelper;
157
158// clang-format off
159#define ANGLE_IMPL_TYPE_HELPER_GL(OBJ) \
160template<> \
161struct ImplTypeHelper<gl::OBJ> \
162{ \
163 using ImplType = OBJ##Mtl; \
164};
165// clang-format on
166
167ANGLE_GL_OBJECTS_X(ANGLE_IMPL_TYPE_HELPER_GL)
168
169template <>
170struct ImplTypeHelper<egl::Display>
171{
172 using ImplType = DisplayMtl;
173};
174
175template <>
176struct ImplTypeHelper<egl::Image>
177{
178 using ImplType = ImageMtl;
179};
180
181template <typename T>
182using GetImplType = typename ImplTypeHelper<T>::ImplType;
183
184template <typename T>
185GetImplType<T> *GetImpl(const T *glObject)
186{
187 return GetImplAs<GetImplType<T>>(glObject);
188}
189
190// This class wraps Objective-C pointer inside, it will manage the lifetime of
191// the Objective-C pointer. Changing pointer is not supported outside subclass.
192template <typename T>
193class WrappedObject
194{
195 public:
196 WrappedObject() = default;
197 ~WrappedObject() { release(); }
198
199 bool valid() const { return (mMetalObject != nil); }
200
201 T get() const { return mMetalObject; }
202 inline void reset() { release(); }
203
204 operator T() const { return get(); }
205
206 protected:
207 inline void set(T obj) { retainAssign(obj); }
208
209 void retainAssign(T obj)
210 {
211 T retained = obj;
212#if !__has_feature(objc_arc)
213 [retained retain];
214#endif
215 release();
216 mMetalObject = obj;
217 }
218
219 private:
220 void release()
221 {
222#if !__has_feature(objc_arc)
223 [mMetalObject release];
224#endif
225 mMetalObject = nil;
226 }
227
228 T mMetalObject = nil;
229};
230
231// This class is similar to WrappedObject, however, it allows changing the
232// internal pointer with public methods.
233template <typename T>
234class AutoObjCPtr : public WrappedObject<T>
235{
236 public:
237 using ParentType = WrappedObject<T>;
238
239 AutoObjCPtr() {}
240
241 AutoObjCPtr(std::nullptr_t) {}
242
243 AutoObjCPtr(const AutoObjCPtr &src) { this->retainAssign(src.get()); }
244
245 AutoObjCPtr(AutoObjCPtr &&src) { this->transfer(std::forward<AutoObjCPtr>(src)); }
246
247 // Take ownership of the pointer
248 AutoObjCPtr(T &&src)
249 {
250 this->retainAssign(src);
251 src = nil;
252 }
253
254 AutoObjCPtr &operator=(const AutoObjCPtr &src)
255 {
256 this->retainAssign(src.get());
257 return *this;
258 }
259
260 AutoObjCPtr &operator=(AutoObjCPtr &&src)
261 {
262 this->transfer(std::forward<AutoObjCPtr>(src));
263 return *this;
264 }
265
266 // Take ownership of the pointer
267 AutoObjCPtr &operator=(T &&src)
268 {
269 this->retainAssign(src);
270 src = nil;
271 return *this;
272 }
273
274 AutoObjCPtr &operator=(std::nullptr_t)
275 {
276 this->set(nil);
277 return *this;
278 }
279
280 bool operator==(const AutoObjCPtr &rhs) const { return (*this) == rhs.get(); }
281
282 bool operator==(T rhs) const { return this->get() == rhs; }
283
284 bool operator==(std::nullptr_t) const { return this->get() == nullptr; }
285
286 inline operator bool() { return this->get(); }
287
288 bool operator!=(const AutoObjCPtr &rhs) const { return (*this) != rhs.get(); }
289
290 bool operator!=(T rhs) const { return this->get() != rhs; }
291
292 bool operator!=(std::nullptr_t) const { return this->get() != nullptr; }
293
294 using ParentType::retainAssign;
295
296 private:
297 void transfer(AutoObjCPtr &&src)
298 {
299 this->retainAssign(std::move(src.get()));
300 src.reset();
301 }
302};
303
304template <typename T>
305using AutoObjCObj = AutoObjCPtr<T *>;
306
307// NOTE: SharedEvent is only declared on iOS 12.0+ or mac 10.14+
308#if defined(__IPHONE_12_0) || defined(__MAC_10_14)
309#define ANGLE_MTL_EVENT_AVAILABLE 1
310using SharedEventRef = AutoObjCPtr<id<MTLSharedEvent>>;
311#else
312#define ANGLE_MTL_EVENT_AVAILABLE 0
313using SharedEventRef = AutoObjCObj<NSObject>;
314#endif
315
316// The native image index used by Metal back-end, the image index uses native mipmap level instead
317// of "virtual" level modified by OpenGL's base level.
318using MipmapNativeLevel = gl::LevelIndexWrapper<uint32_t>;
319constexpr MipmapNativeLevel kZeroNativeMipLevel(0);
320class ImageNativeIndexIterator;
321class ImageNativeIndex final
322{
323 public:
324 ImageNativeIndex() = delete;
325 ImageNativeIndex(const gl::ImageIndex &src, GLint baseLevel)
326 {
327 mNativeIndex = gl::ImageIndex::MakeFromType(src.getType(), src.getLevelIndex() - baseLevel,
328 src.getLayerIndex(), src.getLayerCount());
329 }
330 static ImageNativeIndex FromBaseZeroGLIndex(const gl::ImageIndex &src)
331 {
332 return ImageNativeIndex(src, 0);
333 }
334 MipmapNativeLevel getNativeLevel() const
335 {
336 return MipmapNativeLevel(mNativeIndex.getLevelIndex());
337 }
338 gl::TextureType getType() const { return mNativeIndex.getType(); }
339 GLint getLayerIndex() const { return mNativeIndex.getLayerIndex(); }
340 GLint getLayerCount() const { return mNativeIndex.getLayerCount(); }
341 GLint cubeMapFaceIndex() const { return mNativeIndex.cubeMapFaceIndex(); }
342 bool isLayered() const { return mNativeIndex.isLayered(); }
343 bool hasLayer() const { return mNativeIndex.hasLayer(); }
344 bool has3DLayer() const { return mNativeIndex.has3DLayer(); }
345 bool usesTex3D() const { return mNativeIndex.usesTex3D(); }
346 bool valid() const { return mNativeIndex.valid(); }
347 ImageNativeIndexIterator getLayerIterator(GLint layerCount) const;
348 private:
349 gl::ImageIndex mNativeIndex;
350};
351class ImageNativeIndexIterator final
352{
353 public:
354 ImageNativeIndex next() { return ImageNativeIndex(mNativeIndexIte.next(), 0); }
355 ImageNativeIndex current() const { return ImageNativeIndex(mNativeIndexIte.current(), 0); }
356 bool hasNext() const { return mNativeIndexIte.hasNext(); }
357 private:
358 // This class is only constructable from ImageNativeIndex
359 friend class ImageNativeIndex;
360 explicit ImageNativeIndexIterator(const gl::ImageIndexIterator &baseZeroSrc)
361 : mNativeIndexIte(baseZeroSrc)
362 {}
363 gl::ImageIndexIterator mNativeIndexIte;
364};
365using ClearColorValueBytes = std::array<uint8_t, 4 * sizeof(float)>;
366class ClearColorValue
367{
368 public:
369 constexpr ClearColorValue()
370 : mType(PixelType::Float), mRedF(0), mGreenF(0), mBlueF(0), mAlphaF(0)
371 {}
372 constexpr ClearColorValue(float r, float g, float b, float a)
373 : mType(PixelType::Float), mRedF(r), mGreenF(g), mBlueF(b), mAlphaF(a)
374 {}
375 constexpr ClearColorValue(int32_t r, int32_t g, int32_t b, int32_t a)
376 : mType(PixelType::Int), mRedI(r), mGreenI(g), mBlueI(b), mAlphaI(a)
377 {}
378 constexpr ClearColorValue(uint32_t r, uint32_t g, uint32_t b, uint32_t a)
379 : mType(PixelType::UInt), mRedU(r), mGreenU(g), mBlueU(b), mAlphaU(a)
380 {}
381 constexpr ClearColorValue(const ClearColorValue &src)
382 : mType(src.mType), mValueBytes(src.mValueBytes)
383 {}
384 MTLClearColor toMTLClearColor() const;
385 PixelType getType() const { return mType; }
386 const ClearColorValueBytes &getValueBytes() const { return mValueBytes; }
387 ClearColorValue &operator=(const ClearColorValue &src);
388 void setAsFloat(float r, float g, float b, float a);
389 void setAsInt(int32_t r, int32_t g, int32_t b, int32_t a);
390 void setAsUInt(uint32_t r, uint32_t g, uint32_t b, uint32_t a);
391 private:
392 PixelType mType;
393 union
394 {
395 struct
396 {
397 float mRedF, mGreenF, mBlueF, mAlphaF;
398 };
399 struct
400 {
401 int32_t mRedI, mGreenI, mBlueI, mAlphaI;
402 };
403 struct
404 {
405 uint32_t mRedU, mGreenU, mBlueU, mAlphaU;
406 };
407 ClearColorValueBytes mValueBytes;
408 };
409};
410
411class CommandQueue;
412class ErrorHandler
413{
414 public:
415 virtual ~ErrorHandler() {}
416
417 virtual void handleError(GLenum error,
418 const char *file,
419 const char *function,
420 unsigned int line) = 0;
421
422 virtual void handleError(NSError *error,
423 const char *file,
424 const char *function,
425 unsigned int line) = 0;
426};
427
428class Context : public ErrorHandler
429{
430 public:
431 Context(DisplayMtl *displayMtl);
432 id<MTLDevice> getMetalDevice() const;
433 mtl::CommandQueue &cmdQueue();
434
435 DisplayMtl *getDisplay() const { return mDisplay; }
436
437 protected:
438 DisplayMtl *mDisplay;
439};
440
441#define ANGLE_MTL_CHECK(context, test, error) \
442 do \
443 { \
444 if (ANGLE_UNLIKELY(!(test))) \
445 { \
446 context->handleError(error, __FILE__, ANGLE_FUNCTION, __LINE__); \
447 return angle::Result::Stop; \
448 } \
449 } while (0)
450
451#define ANGLE_MTL_TRY(context, test) ANGLE_MTL_CHECK(context, test, GL_INVALID_OPERATION)
452
453#define ANGLE_MTL_UNREACHABLE(context) \
454 UNREACHABLE(); \
455 ANGLE_MTL_TRY(context, false)
456
457} // namespace mtl
458} // namespace rx
